member.name: T:ZNode.Libraries.DataAccess.Data.StringTokenizer
member.summary: Implements a StringTokenizer class for splitting a string into substrings using a set of delimiters.
member.remarks: C# version of the java.util.StringTokenizer class. Basicly it's a wrapper class around the String.Split method. It implements all of it's Java equivalent methods apart from those only needed by the Enumeration interface. All implemented Java-compilant methods have their C# equivalents in properties. They however differ in names since Java uses the (Hungarian-like) notation runMe() while C# uses Camel-cased RunMe() and thus Java's nextToken() method is just an alias of the NextToken property.

member.name: F:ZNode.Libraries.DataAccess.Data.StringTokenizer.DefaultDelimiters
member.summary: String conatining the default set of delimiters which are " \t\n\r\f": the space character, the tab character, the newline character, the carriage-return character, and the form-feed character.

member.name: M:ZNode.Libraries.DataAccess.Data.StringTokenizer.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a string tokenizer for the specified string using the default delimiters.
member.exception: Thrown when the passed string is null

member.exception: Thrown when the passed string is null

member.summary: Constructs a string tokenizer for the specified string using the given delimiters.

member.summary: Constructs a string tokenizer for the specified string using the given delimiters and optionally returning them as tokens.
member.param: The delimiters used to tokenize the string (each will be used as a delimiter).

member.exception: Thrown when the passed string is null

member.summary: Constructs a string tokenizer for the specified string using the given delimiters, optionally returning them as tokens. Also empty tokens may be returned using the string.
member.param: The delimiters used to tokenize the string (each will be used as a delimiter).
If set to true the encountered delimiters will also be returned as tokens.
If set to true empty tokens will also be returned.

member.summary: Constructs a string tokenizer for the specified string using the given delimiters, optionally returning them as tokens. Also empty tokens may be returned using the string.
member.param: The delimiters used to tokenize the string (each will be used as a delimiter).

member.exception: Thrown when the passed string is null

member.name: M:ZNode.Libraries.DataAccess.Data.StringTokenizer.Reset
member.summary: Resets the current position index so that the tokens can be extracted again.

member.name: M:ZNode.Libraries.DataAccess.Data.StringTokenizer.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.
member.returns: A that can be used to iterate through the collection.

member.name: P:ZNode.Libraries.DataAccess.Data.StringTokenizer.HasMoreTokens
member.summary: Tests if there are more tokens available from this tokenizer's string. If this method returns true, then a subsequent use of the property will successfully return a token.
member.value: true if more tokens are available; otherwise false.

member.name: P:ZNode.Libraries.DataAccess.Data.StringTokenizer.NextToken
member.summary: Gets the next token.
member.exception: Thrown when trying to get a token which doesn't exist. Usually caused by not checking if the property returns true before trying to get the next token.

member.name: P:ZNode.Libraries.DataAccess.Data.StringTokenizer.CountTokens
member.summary: Counts the tokens - the number of times the property can be used before it throws an exception.

member.name: P:ZNode.Libraries.DataAccess.Data.StringTokenizer.Count
member.summary: Gets the total number of tokens extracted.
member.remarks: This property returns the total number of extracted tokens, contrary to .

member.name: P:ZNode.Libraries.DataAccess.Data.StringTokenizer.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the token with the specified index from the tokenizer without moving the current position index.
member.param: The index of the token to get.
member.value: The token with the given index
member.exception: Thrown when trying to get a token which doesn't exist, that is when is equal or greater then or is negative.

member.name: P:ZNode.Libraries.DataAccess.Data.StringTokenizer.EmptyString
member.summary: Gets the currently set string for empty tokens.
